    • Method Detail

      • readDataFile

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String[]> readDataFile(java.lang.String modelName,
                                                            java.lang.String filename)
        this function reads data from given file and create models based on the modelName
        Parameters:
        modelName - name of the concrete model that we want to view and modify
        filename - name of the file that we want to read from
        Returns:
        list of String[] where each element represents the data of the objects in the model array list

      • readDataDB

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String[]> readDataDB(java.lang.String modelName)
                                                   throws NoItemWasFoundException
        Parameters:
        modelName - name of the concrete model that we want to view and modify
        Returns:
        list of String[] where each element represents the data of the objects in the model array list
        Throws:
        NoItemWasFoundException - if there are no data found in the database

      • extractData

        public void extractData(java.lang.String filename)
        Parameters:
        filename - name of the file where we are going to save our data

      • getData

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String[]> getData()
        returns data stored in the model
        Returns:
        ArrayList of String array representation of all the objects in our models ArrayList

      • addData

        public void addData(java.lang.String[] newData)
        adds new data to models array list and add the index to modified index list
        Parameters:

      • updateData

        public void updateData(java.lang.String[] modifiedData,
                       int index)
        updates an existing record with new data at a certain index
        Parameters:
        modifiedData - the new data that we need to update our object with
        index - of the object that needs to be updated

      • deleteData

        public void deleteData(int index)
                throws DependencyException
        Parameters:
        index - of the object that needs to be deleted
        Throws:
        DependencyException - if other records depends on the deleted record (foreign key)

      • saveData

        public void saveData()
              throws DependencyException
        saves data for the modified model objects
        Throws:
        DependencyException - if trying to save data using a foreign key that does not exist

      • isModified

        public boolean isModified()
        Returns:
        boolean that identify if there were modifications made to the models in the controller
